title: Linux lpd Command with Practical Examples
description: Explore the lpd command, a powerful tool for managing print jobs in Linux. Learn how to configure the lpd daemon, control print queues, and troubleshoot printing issues with practical examples.

verify.name: Verify lpd service status
verify.hint: The lpd service should be active and running on the system. Please check the service status using the `systemctl status lpd` command.

verify.name: Verify print queue creation
verify.hint: The 'myprinter' print queue should be listed when running the `sudo lpstat -a` command.

verify.name: Verify print queue enablement
verify.hint: The 'myprinter' print queue should be listed as "accepting requests" when running the `sudo lpstat -a` command.

verify.name: Verify print job submission
verify.hint: The 'test_print.txt' file should be listed in the print queue when running the `sudo lpq myprinter` command.

verify.name: Verify print job cancellation
verify.hint: The print queue should be empty when running the `sudo lpq myprinter` command after canceling the print job.
